body_html:
Yes, tf.gather only operates on the first dimension, so what I had in mind was:

...make sure that perm is a permutation of [0:ndims-1]...
transposed_indices = tf.transpose(tf.gather(tf.transpose(indices), perm))

instead of the less general

transposed_indices = array_ops.concat(1, [indices[:, 1:2], indices[:, 0:1]])
body_text:
Yes, tf.gather only operates on the first dimension, so what I had in mind was:
...make sure that perm is a permutation of [0:ndims-1]...
transposed_indices = tf.transpose(tf.gather(tf.transpose(indices), perm))
instead of the less general
transposed_indices = array_ops.concat(1, [indices[:, 1:2], indices[:, 0:1]])
body:
Yes, tf.gather only operates on the first dimension, so what I had in mind was:

...make sure that perm is a permutation of [0:ndims-1]...
transposed_indices = tf.transpose(tf.gather(tf.transpose(indices), perm))

instead of the less general

transposed_indices = array_ops.concat(1, [indices[:, 1:2], indices[:, 0:1]])
